thread.title: Five-star DE visiting Alabama on Friday - 247Sports
thread.title_full: Five-star DE visiting Alabama on Friday - 247Sports

title: Five-star DE visiting Alabama on Friday - 247Sports
text:
Manage Five-star DE visiting Alabama on Friday Alabama is receiving a visit from one of the top overall players in the 2018 class on Friday. 
Five-star defensive end KJ Henry is making his way to Tuscaloosa on Friday, he reported on Twitter. 
Day two... We in Bama #RollTide â€” The KJ Henry (@ywd_ballislife) March 10, 2017 
The Clemmons (N.C.) West Forsyth product doesn't have an official list of top schools, but the Crimson Tide has long been a program of interest. 
"Obviously it's a top-tier program every year," Henry recently told 247Sports' Anna Hickey . "Coach (Nick) Saban definitely wants to win. Having them want me is kind of overwhelming, but I definitely want to show that respect back." 
The 6-foot-5.5, 235-pounder, is considered a top target in the 2018 class. He's being recruited by outside linebackers coach Tosh Lupoi. 
Henry is rated the No. 2 weak-side defensive end and the No. 19 overall player in the country, per the industry-generated 247Sports Composite. 
Clemson is the 247Sports Crystal Ball favorite at 100 percent.
